observation: I can see a signup form with a 'Select your residence' page. There's a country/region dropdown that currently shows 'Select' placeholder text, and I can see many country options in the dropdown list. There's also a red 'Next' button at the bottom and language selection modals that seem to be open on both sides of the screen. I notice I need to first close these language modals, then select a country from the dropdown.
reasoning: As an elderly user with limited tech experience, I notice there are language selection modals open that are cluttering the interface. I should close these first to simplify the view, then proceed to select a country. I can see a close button (element 23) for the language modal on the right side.
ux_issues: Multiple language modals are open simultaneously, creating a cluttered and confusing interface for elderly users
The interface has too many overlapping elements which could be overwhelming

outcome.visual_observation: The language modal overlay has been successfully closed. The numbered annotations/markers that were overlaying the interface in the BEFORE screenshot have been removed, revealing a clean interface. The main content showing 'Select your residence' form is now clearly visible without obstruction.
